title: For a first order reaction, the rate constant is 0.1 per second. How much time will it take to reduce the concentration from the initial value of 0.6 mole per litre to 0.06 mole per litre? - Quora

response.answer_text: AnswerGiven that Order of reaction =first Rate constant k = 60 sec^ -1 If initial concentration [R]^o = w g Then final concentration [R] = w/16 g Use the formula of first order reaction t = 4.6 × 10^−2 sAnswer Time = 4.6 × 10^−2 s.

Hello? I am not doing your homework for you! I keep seeing questions like this on Quora. The questioner clearly has access to a computer and the answers to the question are available in simple Google searches. We are talking about just basic principles here, not tricky problems to solve. So I ask questioners who have questions like this to stop asking us to do your homework for you. You clearly have access to a computer. Learn to look up things for yourself and do a few simple calculations. Stop being intellectually lazy.
